intro: Railliardia sherffiana var. paucinervia, commonly known as the slender-veined railliardia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its compact rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces striking, tubular red flowers that bloom during the warmer months. Its foliage is covered in fine, white pubescence, which helps reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires careful conservation efforts.
